Average True Range

Average True Range

The Average True Range is a technical analysis indicator used in trading.

How it works

The Average True Range measures market volatility by decomposing the entire range of an asset price for that period. Higher ATR values indicate higher volatility.

Parameters

  • period: Lookback period (default: 14)

Interpretation

  • Rising ATR: Increasing volatility
  • Falling ATR: Decreasing volatility
  • High ATR: Good for trend following
  • Low ATR: Potential range-bound market

Example Usage

// Example of using Average True Range in Rust
let result = indicators::atr(&data, 14);
